newsitem.title: USA: NCAA BASKETBALL-LOUISVILLE'S CRUM PICKS UP 600TH WIN.
newsitem.headline: NCAA BASKETBALL-LOUISVILLE'S CRUM PICKS UP 600TH WIN.

text.p: University of Louisville coach Denny Crum picked up the 600th career victory of his college coaching career on Saturday.
Crum, one of three active college coaches in the Basketball Hall of Fame, joined the 600 club when his Louisville Cardinals beat Georgia Tech 60-56.
The 59-year-old Crum has compiled a 600-225 coaching mark in 26 years at Louisville.
Crum is the 19th coach to reach the 600-win milestone. He guided the Cardinals to national championships in 1980 and 1986 and six Final Four appearances.
Louisville improved to 13-1 with Saturday's victory. Crum has coached the Cardinals to 20 or more victories in 20 of his 25 seasons.
